verses.verse: Then<WG2532> the Pharisees,<WG5330> and<WG2532> some<WG5100> of the scribes<WG1122> gathered together<WG4863> to<WG4314> him,<WG846> having come<WG2064> from<WG575> Jerusalem.<WG2414>

Now<WG2532> when they saw<WG1492> some<WG5100> of<WG3101> his<WG846> disciples<WG3101> eating<WG2068> bread<WG740> with<WG5495> defiled,<WG2839> that<WG5124> is,<WG2076> unwashed,<WG449> hands,<WG5495> they found fault.<WG3201>

(For<WG1063> the Pharisees,<WG5330> and<WG2532> all<WG3956> the Jews,<WG2453> don't<WG2068> eat unless<WG1437> they wash<WG3538> their hands<WG5495> and forearms,<WG4435> holding<WG2902> to the tradition<WG3862> of the elders.<WG4245>

They<WG2532> don't<WG3756> eat<WG2068> when they come from<WG575> the marketplace,<WG58> unless<WG3362> <WG3361> they bathe<WG907> themselves,<WG2532> and there are<WG2076> many<WG4183> other things,<WG243> which<WG3739> they have received<WG3880> to hold<WG2902> to:<WG909> washings of cups,<WG4221> <WG2532> pitchers,<WG3582> <WG2532> bronze vessels,<WG5473> and<WG2532> couches.<WG2825>)

The<WG1899> Pharisees<WG5330> and<WG2532> the scribes<WG1122> asked<WG1905> him,<WG1223> "Why<WG5101> don't<WG3756> your<WG4675> disciples<WG3101> walk<WG4043> according to<WG2596> the tradition<WG3862> of the elders,<WG4245> but<WG235> eat<WG2068> their bread<WG740> with<WG5495> unwashed<WG449> hands?<WG5495>"

He<WG1161> answered<WG611> them,<WG3754> "Well<WG2573> did<WG4395> Isaiah<WG2268> prophesy<WG4395> of<WG4012> you<WG5216> hypocrites,<WG5273> as<WG5613> it is written,<WG1125> <WG3778> 'This people<WG2992> honors<WG5091> me<WG3165> with<WG5491> their lips,<WG5491> but<WG1161> their<WG846> heart<WG2588> is<WG568> far<WG4206> from<WG575> me.<WG1700>
But<WG1161> in vain<WG3155> do they worship<WG4576> me,<WG3165> teaching<WG1321> as doctrines<WG1319> the commandments<WG1778> of men.<WG444>'

"For<WG1063> you set aside<WG863> the commandment<WG1785> of God,<WG2316> and hold<WG2902> tightly to the tradition<WG3862> of men<WG444>â€” the washing<WG909> of pitchers<WG3582> and<WG2532> cups,<WG4221> and<WG2532> you do<WG4160> many<WG4183> other<WG243> such<WG5108> things.<WG3946>"
He<WG2532> said<WG3004> to them,<WG846> "Full well<WG2573> do you reject<WG114> the commandment<WG1785> of God,<WG2316> that<WG2443> you may keep<WG5083> your<WG5216> tradition.<WG3862>

For<WG1063> Moses<WG3475> said,<WG2036> <WG5091> 'Honor your<WG4675> father<WG3962> and<WG2532> your<WG4675> mother;<WG3384>' and,<WG2532> <WG2551> 'He who speaks evil of father<WG3962> or<WG2228> mother,<WG3384> let him be put<WG5053> to death.<WG5053>'

But<WG1161> you<WG5210> say,<WG3004> <WG1437> 'If a man<WG444> tells<WG2036> his father<WG3962> or<WG2228> his mother,<WG3384> "Whatever<WG1437> profit<WG5623> you might have received<WG1537> from<WG1537> me<WG1700> is Corban,<WG2878> that<WG3739> is to say,<WG2076> given to God;<WG1435>"'
then<WG2532> you no longer<WG3765> allow<WG863> him<WG846> to do<WG4160> anything<WG3762> for<WG3962> his<WG846> father<WG3962> or<WG2228> his<WG846> mother,<WG3384>

making<WG208> void<WG208> the word<WG3056> of God<WG2316> by your<WG5216> tradition,<WG3862> which<WG3739> you have handed<WG3860> down.<WG2532> You do<WG4160> many<WG4183> things<WG3946> like this.<WG4160>"
He<WG2532> called<WG4341> all<WG3956> the multitude<WG3793> to himself,<WG3004> and said to them,<WG846> "Hear<WG191> me,<WG3450> all<WG3956> of you,<WG2532> and understand.<WG4920>

There is<WG2076> nothing<WG3762> from outside<WG1855> of the man,<WG444> that<WG3739> going<WG1531> into<WG1519> him<WG846> can<WG1410> defile<WG2840> him;<WG846> but<WG235> the things which proceed out<WG1607> of<WG575> the man<WG846> are those<WG1565> that<WG2076> defile<WG2840> the man.<WG444>
If<WG1487> anyone<WG5100> has<WG2192> ears<WG3775> to hear,<WG191> let him hear!<WG191>"
When<WG3753> he had entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> a house<WG3624> away from<WG575> the multitude,<WG3793> his<WG846> disciples<WG3101> asked<WG1905> him<WG846> about<WG4012> the parable.<WG3850>

He<WG2532> said<WG3004> to them,<WG846> "Are<WG2075> you<WG5210> thus<WG3779> without understanding<WG801> also?<WG2532> Don't<WG3756> you<WG3539> perceive<WG3539> that<WG3754> whatever<WG3956> goes<WG1531> into<WG1519> the man<WG444> from outside<WG1855> <WG1410> can't<WG3756> defile<WG2840> him,<WG846>

because<WG3754> it doesn't<WG3756> go<WG1531> into<WG1519> his<WG846> heart,<WG2588> but<WG235> into<WG1519> his stomach,<WG2836> then<WG2532><WG99999> into<WG1519> the latrine,<WG856> thus purifying<WG2511> all<WG3956> foods?<WG1033>"
He said,<WG3754> "That which proceeds out<WG1607> of<WG1537> the man,<WG444> that<WG1565> defiles<WG2840> the man.<WG444>

For<WG1063> from within,<WG2081> out<WG1537> of the hearts<WG2588> of men,<WG444> proceed<WG1607> evil<WG2556> thoughts,<WG1261> adulteries,<WG3430> sexual sins,<WG4202> murders,<WG5408> thefts,<WG2829>
covetings,<WG4124> wickedness,<WG4189> deceit,<WG1388> lustful desires,<WG766> an<WG3788> evil<WG4190> eye,<WG3788> blasphemy,<WG988> pride,<WG5243> and foolishness.<WG877>
All<WG3956> these<WG5023> evil things<WG4190> come<WG1607> from within,<WG2081> and<WG2532> defile<WG2840> the man.<WG444>"

From<WG2532> there<WG1564> he arose,<WG450> and went<WG565> away into<WG1519> the borders<WG3181> of Tyre<WG5184> and<WG2532> Sidon.<WG4605> He<WG2532> entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> a house,<WG3614> and didn't<WG2309> want anyone<WG3762> to know<WG1097> it,<WG2532> but he<WG1410> couldn't<WG3756> escape notice.<WG2990>

For<WG1063> a<WG1135> woman,<WG1135> whose<WG3739> little daughter<WG2365> had<WG2192> an<WG4151> unclean<WG169> spirit,<WG4151> having<WG2192> heard<WG191> of<WG4012> him,<WG846> came<WG2064> and fell<WG4363> down at<WG4314> his<WG846> feet.<WG4228>

Now the woman<WG1135> was<WG2258> a Greek,<WG1674> a Syrophoenician<WG4949> by race.<WG1085> She<WG2532> begged<WG2065> him<WG846> that<WG2443> he would cast<WG1544> the demon<WG1140> out<WG1544> of<WG2364> her<WG846> daughter.<WG2364>

But<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> said<WG2036> to her,<WG846> "Let<WG863> the children<WG5043> be filled<WG5526> first,<WG4412> for<WG1063> it is<WG2076> not<WG3756> appropriate<WG2570> to take<WG2983> the children<WG5043>'s bread<WG740> and<WG2532> throw<WG906> it to the dogs.<WG2952>"

But<WG1161> she answered<WG611> <WG2532><WG99999> him,<WG846> "Yes,<WG3483> Lord.<WG2532> Yet<WG1063> even the dogs<WG2952> under<WG5270> the table<WG5132> eat<WG2068> the<WG575> children<WG3813>'s crumbs.<WG5589>"
He<WG2532> said<WG2036> to her,<WG846> "For<WG1223> this<WG5126> saying,<WG3056> go your way.<WG5217> The demon<WG1140> has gone out<WG1831> of<WG1537> your<WG4675> daughter.<WG2364>"

She<WG2532> went<WG565> away to<WG1519> her<WG846> house,<WG3624> and<WG2532> found<WG2147> the child<WG2364> having been laid<WG906> on<WG1909> the bed,<WG2825> with the demon<WG1140> gone out.<WG1831>

<WG2532> Again<WG3825> he departed<WG1831> from<WG1537> the borders<WG3725> of Tyre<WG5184> and<WG2532> Sidon,<WG4605> and came<WG2064> to<WG4314> the sea<WG2281> of Galilee,<WG1056> through<WG303> the midst<WG3319> of the region<WG3725> of Decapolis.<WG1179>

They<WG2532> brought<WG5342> to him<WG846> one who was deaf<WG2974> and<WG2532> had an impediment in his speech.<WG3424> They begged<WG3870> him<WG846> to<WG2443> lay<WG2007> his hand<WG5495> on<WG2007> him.<WG846>

He<WG2532> took<WG618> him<WG846> aside<WG2596> <WG2398> from<WG575> the multitude,<WG3793> privately,<WG906> and put his<WG846> fingers<WG1147> into<WG1519> his<WG846> ears,<WG3775> and<WG2532> he spat,<WG4429> and touched<WG680> his<WG846> tongue.<WG1100>
Looking<WG2532> up<WG308> to<WG1519> heaven,<WG3772> he sighed,<WG4727> and<WG2532> said<WG3004> to him,<WG846> "Ephphatha!<WG2188>" that<WG3739> is,<WG2076> "Be opened!<WG1272>"

<WG2532> Immediately<WG2112> his<WG846> ears<WG189> were opened,<WG1272> and<WG2532> the impediment<WG1199> of<WG1100> his<WG846> tongue<WG1100> was released,<WG3089> and<WG2532> he spoke<WG2980> clearly.<WG3723>

He<WG2532> commanded<WG1291> them<WG846> that<WG2443> they should tell<WG2036> no one,<WG3367> but<WG1161> the more<WG3745> he<WG846> commanded<WG1291> them,<WG846> so much the more<WG3123> widely<WG4054> they proclaimed it.<WG2784>

They<WG2532> were<WG1605> astonished<WG1605> beyond measure,<WG5249> saying,<WG3004> "He has done<WG4160> all things<WG3956> well.<WG2573> He makes<WG4160> even<WG2532> the deaf<WG2974> hear,<WG191> and<WG2532> the mute<WG216> speak!<WG2980>"
